    • Method Detail

      • importSkos

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response importSkos(String scopeId,
                                            Boolean tolerant,
                                            String baseURI,
                                            String logMessage,
                                            String format,
                                            InputStream stream)
                                     throws ItemNotFound,
                                            ValidationError,
                                            IOException,
                                            DeserializationError
        Import a SKOS file, of varying formats, as specified by the "language" column of the file extensions table here.

        Example: 

            
 curl -X POST \
      -H "X-User: mike" \
      --data-binary @skos-data.rdf \
      "http://localhost:7474/ehri/import/skos?scope=gb-my-vocabulary&log=testing&tolerant=true"
        Parameters:
        scopeId - the id of the import scope (i.e. repository)
        tolerant - whether or not to die on the first validation error
        logMessage - log message for import. If this refers to an accessible local file its contents will be used.
        format - the RDF format of the POSTed data
        stream - a stream of SKOS data in a valid format.
        Returns:
        a JSON object showing how many records were created, updated, or unchanged.
        Throws:
        ItemNotFound
        ValidationError
        IOException
        DeserializationError

      • importEad

        public ImportLog importEad(String scopeId,
                           Boolean tolerant,
                           Boolean allowUpdates,
                           String logMessage,
                           String propertyFile,
                           String handlerClass,
                           String importerClass,
                           InputStream data)
                    throws ItemNotFound,
                           ValidationError,
                           IOException,
                           DeserializationError
        Import a set of EAD files. The POST body can be one of:
        • a single EAD file
        • multiple EAD files in an archive
        • a plain test file containing local file paths
        The Content-Type header is used to distinguish the contents.
        Note: The archive does not currently support compression.

        The way you would run with would typically be: 

            
     curl -X POST \
      -H "X-User: mike" \
      --data-binary @ead-list.txt \
      "http://localhost:7474/ehri/import/ead?scope=my-repo-id&log=testing&tolerant=true"

 # NB: Data is sent using --data-binary to preserve line-breaks - otherwise
 # it needs url encoding.

        (Assuming ead-list.txt is a list of newline separated EAD file paths.)

        (TODO: Might be better to use a different way of encoding the local file paths...)

        Parameters:
        scopeId - the id of the import scope (i.e. repository)
        tolerant - whether or not to die on the first validation error
        allowUpdates - allow the importer to update items that already exist. If it attempts to do so without this option enabled an error will be thrown
        logMessage - log message for import. If this refers to an accessible local file its contents will be used.
        handlerClass - the fully-qualified handler class name (defaults to EadHandler)
        importerClass - the fully-qualified import class name (defaults to EadImporter)
        propertyFile - a local file path pointing to an import properties configuration file.
        data - file data containing one of: a single EAD file, multiple EAD files in an archive, a list of local file paths. The Content-Type header is used to distinguish the contents.
        Returns:
        a JSON object showing how many records were created, updated, or unchanged.
        Throws:
        ItemNotFound
        ValidationError
        IOException
        DeserializationError

      • importCsv

        public ImportLog importCsv(String scopeId,
                           Boolean tolerant,
                           Boolean allowUpdates,
                           String logMessage,
                           String importerClass,
                           InputStream data)
                    throws ItemNotFound,
                           ValidationError,
                           IOException,
                           DeserializationError
        Import a set of CSV files. See EAD handler for options and defaults but substitute text/csv for the input mimetype when a single file is POSTed.

        Additional note: no handler class is required.

        Throws:
        ItemNotFound
        ValidationError
        IOException
        DeserializationError

      • batchUpdate

        public ImportLog batchUpdate(String scopeId,
                             Boolean tolerant,
                             Boolean version,
                             String logMessage,
                             InputStream inputStream)
                      throws IOException,
                             ItemNotFound,
                             ValidationError,
                             DeserializationError
        Update a batch of items via JSON containing (partial) data bundles.
        Parameters:
        scopeId - the ID of there item's permission scope
        tolerant - whether to allow individual validation failures
        version - whether to create a version prior to delete
        logMessage - an optional log message
        inputStream - a JSON document containing partial bundles containing the needed data transformations
        Returns:
        an import log describing the changes committed
        Throws:
        IOException
        ItemNotFound
        ValidationError
        DeserializationError

      • batchDelete

        public void batchDelete(String scopeId,
                        Boolean version,
                        String logMessage,
                        List<String> ids)
                 throws IOException,
                        ItemNotFound,
                        DeserializationError
        Delete a batch of objects via JSON containing their IDs.
        Parameters:
        scopeId - the ID of there item's permission scope
        version - whether to create a version prior to delete
        logMessage - an optional log message.
        ids - a list of IDs to delete
        Throws:
        IOException
        ItemNotFound
        DeserializationError
